publication/authors: Mahony S, Edwards MD, Mazzoni EO, Sherwood RI, Kakumanu A, Morrison CA, Wichterle H, Gifford DK
publication/title: An integrated model of multiple-condition ChIP-Seq data reveals predeterminants of Cdx2 binding.
dataset/availability: PSMs at http://noble.gs.washington.edu/proj/intense (also stated that availability is upon request but the URL indeed has links to the data)
dataset/provenance: 1208 peptide spectrum matches (PSMs) and 18149 mass spectra for validation
dataset/splits: Positive and negative points for the Bayesian network are mentioned but no further info provided
optimization/algorithm:
"Hybrid dynamic Bayesian network (DBN) / support
vector machine (SVM)"
optimization/encoding: "Pre-processing: Input data obtained from MS/MS data, an aqueous soluble protein sample from E.coli lysate was reduced, carbamidomethylated and digested with trypsin."
optimization/features: "99-dimensional feature vectors generated by Riptide (Bayesian part)"
optimization/parameters: For the SVM, we use a Gaussian kernel, and hyperparameters C (soft margin penalty) and sigma (low case, width of the Gaussian). Hyperparameters are selected using five-fold nested cross-validation, where the parameter with the largest area under the ROC curve is selected.
model/availability: Upon request (but did not try to get it, there is a link to a tar file with, it says, C++ and Python for the Riptide part, I did not examine the files)
evaluation/confidence:
"q value, which is defined as the minimal false discovery rate threshold at which the
 PSM is deemed significant"
evaluation/measure: Kind of discussed but did not see values
evaluation/method: "Comparison against SEQUEST (Riptide with the static SVM outperforms SEQUEST by 10.8% at a 1% false discovery rate) and Percolator"
